The lesson to be learned from the life of Solomon has a special moral bearing upon the life of the aged, of 
                                                                           182
those who are no longer climbing the mountain but are descending and facing the western sun.  We expect to see defects in the characters of youth who are not controlled by love and faith in Jesus Christ. We see youth wavering between right and wrong, vacillating between fixed principle and the almost overpowering current of evil that is bearing them off their feet to ruin. But of those of mature age we expect better things.  We look for the character to be established, for principles to be rooted, and for them to be beyond the danger of pollution.
